item.title: Go Daily Question 131
item.author: loommii
item.description:
Regarding channels, which of the following syntax is correct:

  • A. var ch chan int
  • B. ch := make(chan int)
  • C. <- ch
  • D. ch <-

A, B, C

A declares variable ch of type chan int, but does not initialize it. B declares variable ch of type chan int, and initializes it. C reads from the channel, discarding the value. D is incorrect; writing to a channel requires a value.
